section.heading: Legal recognition of electronic records, electronic signatures, and electronic contracts.

para.text: A record or signature may not be denied legal effect or enforceability solely because it is in electronic form.
A contract may not be denied legal effect or enforceability solely because an electronic record was used in its formation.
If a law requires a record to be in writing, an electronic record satisfies the law.
If a law requires a signature, an electronic signature satisfies the law.

annoGroup.heading: Effect of Amendments
annoGroup.annotation: D.C. Law 15-105 validated previously made technical corrections.

annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see § 3202(b) of Fiscal Year 2002 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2001 (D.C. Act 14-124, August 3, 2001, 48 DCR 7861).

annoGroup.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 7 of the Uniform Electronic Transactions Act (1999 Act).
